H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3100.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Samuel<SDBH:שְׁמוּאֵל>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► ancestor of {L:Heman<SDBH:הֵימָן>}

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H1501.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H3499.def: = what remains in existence after part of the original quantity has disappeared or has been used or dealt with in a certain way; used for humans, animals, plants, and inanimate objects

H697.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3218.def: term found primarily in poetic contexts: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw

H2625.def: exact meaning unkown; probably: = juvenile form of {L:locust<SDBH:אַרְבֶּה>}

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H7910.def: = state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol

H1058.def: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person

H3213.def: = action by which humans utter a high-pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H6071.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation and probably still relatively fresh; ► used as beverage; ≈ associated with agriculture, joy, and well-being, but also with drunkenness; also used in metaphors for aggression and sex

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H6099.def: = state in which humans or animals are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H4973.def: used in poetry only: = large, sharp {L:teeth<SDBH:שֵׁן>} of an animal; ≈ associated with aggression

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H8047.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H7111.def: = a state in which a tree is reduced to small pieces of wood

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H2834.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or animals remove an object that thinly covers another object

H3835.def: literally: to become white; hence: = process by which branches become light in color because they are stripped of their bark

H421.def: = action by which someone invokes the name of a deity and ask him to punish a wrong-doer; ◄ contexts in which this may happen include: (1) covenants and agreements, where the deity is asked to punish those who do not obey the terms of the agreement, (2) cases  where a supposedly wrongful act has been committed, but where there is not enough certainty about the identity of the person who is responsible, and (3) in order to prevent people from committing a wrongful action, knowing that the deity's punishment will be upon them if they do so; ► the effectiveness of the curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H1330.def: = young unmarried woman, who has never been married before, and has never had sex with a man

H2296.def: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H4503.def: = objects given to a person of high status; ► sometimes this is done on a voluntary basis as a show of respect for the recipient and in order to win that person's favor; in other cases this is done to fulfill the requirements imposed by the recipient

H5262.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold; ► functions as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H7703.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H56.def: = to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances

H1715.def: = seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

H8492.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well-being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H535.def: = state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H3323.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food and in various religious rituals

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H406.def: = person practicing agriculture as his profession

H3213.def: = action by which humans utter a high-pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H1612.def: = a creeping plant, which grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H8384.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree"

H535.def: = state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

H7416.def: = a small tree reaching a height of 3-5 m, with narrow, dark green leaves and thorny branches; its has a red flower and produces red round fruits with a hard skin and tightly-packed pockets of seeds inside; ◄ Punica granatum; ► the seeds can be made into wine; the flower-shaped end of the fruit made it an attractive decoration on stone and in the temple; ≈ associated with love, beauty, and sex

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H8558.def: = a type of palm tree, which reaches a height of 10-20 m and has a cluster of large leaves at the top; ◄ Phoenix dactylifera; ► it is cultivated for its edible sweet fruit, about the size of a human thumb, which grows in clusters; ≈ it is symbol of elegance and grace

H8598.def: = a tree that reaches a height of 5-10 meters; it has a rounded crown, and bears a round fruit about the size of an orange; in the spring the tree is completely covered with pink flowers, which gradually give way to the green of the leaves as they develop; the fruit can be greenish, yellow, or red. ◄ Malus sylvestris; ► considered both beautiful and refreshing

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H8342.def: poetic term; = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H2296.def: = state in which someone wears clothes or armor

H5594.def: = action by which human perform the mourning ritual for someone who has died, or for another tragic event; this may include {L:wailing<SDBH:ילל>}, tearing one's clothes, putting on {L:sackcloth<SDBH:שַׂק>}, covering oneself with dust or ashes, {L:fasting<SDBH:צום>} or eating specific food, {L:cutting oneself<SDBH:גדד>}, {L:shaving one's head<SDBH:קרח>}, covering part of one's face, etc.; this usually takes place during a specific period of time and ends after the burial has taken place, but it may also be repeated in later days to commemorate a tragic event

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H3213.def: = action by which humans utter a high-pitched cry to give expression to an emotion, which is usually grief or distress, but can also be triumph and glee

H4196.def: = construction with a flat top, ◄ originally made out of stones that were not cut and shaped with tools, later also out of metal; ► used for burning sacrifices

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H4503.def: = objects given to a person of high status; ► sometimes this is done on a voluntary basis as a show of respect for the recipient and in order to win that person's favor; in other cases this is done to fulfill the requirements imposed by the recipient

H5262.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold; ► functions as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H6942.def: = action by which humans that are part of a {L:holy<SDBH:קָדֹושׁ>} nation set themselves apart from others by not engaging in activities that are not in accordance with God's law

H6685.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H6116.def: = state in which a large group of people has come together for a religious purpose

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H2205.def: = state in which a human being is nearing the end of a long life

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H2199.def: = action by which humans raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7701.def: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

H7706.def: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All-sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

H400.def: = any nutritious substance that people or animals eat or drink ► in order to maintain life and growth

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H8057.def: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H1524.def: mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5685.def: = process by which seed contract or wither into a withered or contorted state ◄ due to lack of moisture

H4053.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = a lump of earth or clay

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H8074.def: = state in which an area has become empty as a result of destruction and depopulation

H2040.def: = state in which something is in extreme disrepair ◄ caused by either neglect or destruction

H1715.def: = seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H584.def: = action by which humans or animals make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H5739.def: = a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle

H1241.def: = large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, ► chiefly domesticated for meat or milk, as beasts of burden, or for pulling a cart or a plow; it is a clean animal and can be eaten and sacrificed; ≈ regarded as a sign of wealth

H943.def: = action by which humans or animals move about from place to place without a clear destination

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4829.def: = open land with enough grass and plants to graze cattle or flocks of sheep and goats

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H6629.def: = group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd

H816.def: = state in which humans bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H4999.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place

H3857.def: poetic term: = process by which fire gives off flames

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H7704.def: = a piece of land generally uninhabited by human beings, but where one can find wild animals and plants and trees; consists of grasslands, fields, desert, or forest; can be used for farming, pasturing animals, and hunting; often used in contrast to inhabited land such as cities or encampments.

H6165.def: = process by which animals produce sounds with effort ◄ due to intense thirst ► to express one's longing for water; ≈ sometimes applied figuratively to one's longing for God

H650.def: = river bed that contains water in the rainy season only; ≈ considered as deceptive as one never can never be entirely sure as to whether they contain water or not

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H4999.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place
